IDI RA

Formerly East Godavari District, Presently Kakinada District, Gandepalli Mandal,
Singarampalem Village Door No. 1-154 Settlement deed jointly executed by the sons of (late) Pilla Nageswara Rao of Rukapurasthula, 1) Pilla Ramesh, aged 30 years (Aadhaar No. XXXX XXXX XXXX), 2) Pilla Ganesh, aged 27 years (Aadhaar No. XXXX XXXX XXXX) and 2) Pilla Ganesh, aged 27 years (Aadhaar No. XXXX XXXX XXXX). You are the brother of the 1st of us. You are the only one of us. Therefore, in consideration of the great love we have for you, we have decided to give you some property, and we hereby grant you the right to possess the property listed in the Schedule below, which has been our ancestral property and has been in our complete possession since that time and to this day, free of charge, without any consideration from you. Therefore, from now on, you shall pay the taxes due to the government and the government, and shall enjoy the property freely and freely with all the rights of donation, donation and sale as you wish, for the benefit of your children, grandchildren and descendants. In this regard, we, our heirs, our subjects, and you, your heirs, and your subjects, at our own expense, will settle all such claims and interests and continue to hold the property in accordance with the schedule below. We hereby declare that this property is undisputed and unencumbered, free from any mortgages, sales, purchase agreements, guarantees, court seizures, wills, donations, etc., and that there are no other rights holders other than us in this property. The 9/77 Act does not apply to this.
P. Ramesh

Kakinada District It has been found in our investigation in Singarampalem village that the vacant residential land (late) as per the schedule given below in Singarampalem village belonging to Singarampalem Gram Panchayat, Gandepalli Mandal, is the property of Pilla Nageswara Rao Garu, sons 1) Pilla Ramesh, 2) Pilla Ganesh Garu, and is in full possession and enjoyment right of them. The said land is not an assigned property. It is not applicable to Act No. 9/77. Therefore, it is hereby certified that the Revenue Department has no objection in this regard. sections.content: The property covered under Gift Settlement Deed No. 391 of 2026, dated 30/Jan/2026, executed by Pilla Ganesh, Pilla Ramesh jointly in favour of Pilla Ganesh, (where as Donee is the brother of the 1st Donor and is representing himself as the 2nd Donor.), towards the property admeasuring an extent of 131 Sq.Yds., located near by house number 1-154, comprised in survey number 339-1, situated in Singarampalem Village, Gandepalli Mandal, erstwhile East Godavari District, now within the District of Kakinada, registered at Sub-Registrar Office, JAGGAMPETA(404) is bounded as follows: North by: 33 Ft 6 Inches House of Randi Appanna South by: 33 Ft. 6 Inches Road East by: 35 Ft. Site of Randi Balayya West by: 35 Ft. Property of Nakka Chinranjeevi
It is noted from the given documents and EC that the schedule property is not part of any active Mortgage or Lease Deed.

Note:It is to be noted that the online EC has been verified using the key parameters, namely the Document Number, Survey Number/House Number, and Split Survey/House Number of the concerned SRO, as per the Deed. However, cross-verification across multiple SROs has not been carried out due to the AP portal’s requirement of separate passwords for each search parameter, and the OTP-based authentication mechanism makes searches across multiple SROs operationally infeasible.
